name: Avoid Harm
trigger: When you dodge, parry, or block Harm,

success.text: You emerge completely unharmed.

partial.text: You avoid the worst of it, but the GM decides if you end up in a bad spot, lose something, or partially sustain Harm.

fail.text: You were too slow to react or you made a bad judgment call. Perhaps you didn’t avoid any Harm at all, or you ended up in an even worse spot than before. The GM makes a Move.

name: Endure Injury
trigger: When enduring an injury,

success.text: You ride out the pain and keep going.

partial.text: You are still standing, but the GM picks one condition:
partial.list: |The injury throws you off balance.|You lose something.|You receive a Serious Wound.

fail.text: The injury is overwhelming. You choose if you:
fail.list: |Are knocked out (the GM may also choose to inflict a Serious Wound).|Receive a Critical Wound, but may continue to act (if you already have a Critical Wound, you may not choose this option again).|Die.

name: Keep it Together
trigger: When you exercise self-control to keep from succumbing to stress, traumatic experiences, psychic influence, or supernatural forces,

success.text: You grit your teeth and stay the course.

partial.text: The effort to resist instills a condition, which remains with you until you have had time to recuperate. You get −1 in situations where this condition would be a hindrance to you. Choose one:
partial.list: |You become angry (−1 Stability).|You become sad (−1 Stability).|You become scared (−1 Stability).|You become guilt-ridden (−1 Stability).|You become obsessed (+1 Relation to whatever caused the condition).|You become distracted (−2 in situations where the condition limits you).|You will be haunted by the experience at a later time.

fail.text: The strain is too much for your mind to handle. The GM chooses your reaction: cower powerless in the threat’s presence, panic with no control of your actions, suffer emotional trauma (−2 Stability), or suffer life-changing trauma (−4 Stability).

name: Act Under Pressure
trigger: When you do something risky, under time pressure, or try to avoid danger,
rollPhrase: the GM will explain what the consequences for failure are and you roll +Coolness:

success.text: You do what you intended.

partial.text: You do it, but hesitate, are delayed, or must deal with a complication – the GM reveals an unexpected outcome, a high price, or a difficult choice.

fail.text: There are serious consequences, you make a mistake, or you’re exposed to the danger. The GM makes a Move.

name: Engage in Combat
trigger: When you engage an able opponent in combat,

success.text: You inflict damage to your opponent and avoid counterattacks.

partial.text: You inflict damage, but at a cost. The GM chooses one:
partial.list: |You’re subjected to a counterattack.|You do less damage than intended.|You lose something important.|You expend all your ammo.|You’re beset by a new threat.|You’ll be in trouble later on.

fail.text: Your attack doesn’t go as anticipated. You might be subjected to bad luck, miss your target, or pay a high price for your assault. The GM makes a Move.

name: Influence Other NPC
trigger: When you influence an NPC through negotiation, argument, or from a position of power,

success.text: She does what you ask

partial.text: She does what you ask, but the GM chooses one:
partial.list: |She demands better compensation.|Complications will arise at a future time.|She gives in for the moment, but will change her mind and regret it later.

fail.text: Your attempt has unintended repercussions. The GM makes a Move.

name: Influence Other PC
trigger: When you influence another PC,

lists.options: |She’s motivated to do what you ask, and recieves +1 for her next roll, if she does it.|She’s worried of the consequences if she doesn’t do what you ask, and gets −1 Stability if she doesn’t do it.

success.text: Both options below.
success.list: |She’s motivated to do what you ask, and recieves +1 for her next roll, if she does it.|She’s worried of the consequences if she doesn’t do what you ask, and gets −1 Stability if she doesn’t do it.

partial.text: Choose one option below.
partial.list: |She’s motivated to do what you ask, and recieves +1 for her next roll, if she does it.|She’s worried of the consequences if she doesn’t do what you ask, and gets −1 Stability if she doesn’t do it.

fail.text: The character gets +1 on her next roll against you. The GM makes a Move.

name: See Through the Illusion
trigger: When you suffer shock, injuries, or distort your perception through drugs or rituals,
rollPhrase: roll +Soul to See Through the Illusion:

success.text: You perceive things as they truly are.

partial.text: You see Reality, but you also affect the Illusion. The GM chooses one:
partial.list: |Something senses you.|The Illusions tears around you.

fail.text: The GM explains what you see and makes a Move.

name: Read a Person
trigger: When you read a person,

lists.questions: |Are you lying?|How do you feel right now?|What are you about to do?|What do you wish I would do?|How could I get you to […]?

success.text: You may ask the GM or player two questions about the target any time you are in conversation with them during this scene.
success.list: |Are you lying?|How do you feel right now?|What are you about to do?|What do you wish I would do?|How could I get you to […]?

partial.text: You may ask the GM or player one question about the target any time you are in conversation with them during this scene.
partial.list: |Are you lying?|How do you feel right now?|What are you about to do?|What do you wish I would do?|How could I get you to […]?

fail.text: You accidentally reveal your own intentions to the person you’re trying to read. Tell the GM/player what these intentions are. The GM makes a Move.

name: Observe a Situation
trigger: When you observe a situation,

lists.questions: |What is my best way through this?|What currently poses the biggest threat?|What can I use to my advantage?|What should I be on the lookout for?|What is being hidden from me?|What seems strange about this?

success.text: Ask two questions about the current situation. When you act on these answers, gain +1 to your rolls.
success.list: |What is my best way through this?|What currently poses the biggest threat?|What can I use to my advantage?|What should I be on the lookout for?|What is being hidden from me?|What seems strange about this?

partial.text: Ask one question about the current situation. When you act on the answer, gain +1 to your rolls.
partial.list: |What is my best way through this?|What currently poses the biggest threat?|What can I use to my advantage?|What should I be on the lookout for?|What is being hidden from me?|What seems strange about this?

fail.text: You get to ask a question anyway, but you get no bonus for it and miss something, attract unwanted attention or expose yourself to danger. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |What is my best way through this?|What currently poses the biggest threat?|What can I use to my advantage?|What should I be on the lookout for?|What is being hidden from me?|What seems strange about this?

name: Investigate
trigger: When you investigate something,

lists.questions: |How can I find out more about what I’m investigating?|What is my gut feel about what I’m investigating?|Is there anything weird about what I’m investigating?

success.text: You uncover all direct leads, and may ask two questions to get additional information.
success.list: |How can I find out more about what I’m investigating?|What is my gut feel about what I’m investigating?|Is there anything weird about what I’m investigating?

partial.text: You uncover all direct leads, and may ask one question to get additional information. The information comes at a cost, determined by the GM, such as requiring someone or something for the answer, exposing yourself to danger, or needing to expend extra time or resources. Will you do what it takes?
partial.list: |How can I find out more about what I’m investigating?|What is my gut feel about what I’m investigating?|Is there anything weird about what I’m investigating?

fail.text: You may get some information anyway, but you pay a price for it. You may expose yourself to dangers or costs. The GM makes a Move.

name: Help Other
trigger: When you help another player character’s Move,
rollPhrase: explain how before their roll and roll +Attribute, where the Attribute is the same as the other player is rolling:

success.text: You may modify the subsequent roll by +2.

partial.text: You may modify the subsequent roll by +1.

fail.text: Your interference has unintended consequences. The GM makes a Move.

name: Hinder Other
trigger: When you hinder another player character’s Move,
rollPhrase: explain how before their roll and roll +Attribute, where the Attribute is the same as the other player is rolling:

success.text: You may modify the subsequent roll by −2.

partial.text: You may modify the subsequent roll by −1.

fail.text: Your interference has unintended consequences. The GM makes a Move.

name: Bad Reputation
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you attract the public’s attention,

description.intro: For some reason, you have attracted the public’s disapproval – even animosity. Perhaps you’ve been spotlighted in the tabloids as a pedophile or murderer, falsely or otherwise.

success.text: You blend in. Nobody is out to get you.

partial.text: You have been recognized. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Several people have recognized you. Anger and fear control their actions. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make a Move representing how your bad reputation sticks to you. For example, people might react with fear and suspicion towards you, a lynch mob forms to bring you to justice, your property is vandalized, your allies turn against you, and you can lose your job, agreements, and relationships.

description.intro: Some experience in your past has broken your psyche so badly you’ve been unable to recuperate from it.
description.static: As a result, your Stability can never increase beyond Distressed [6].

name: Competitor
trigger: Whenever you neglect to protect your interests or are distracted elsewhere,

description.intro: You have a competitor in the criminal underworld, whose business niche is similar to yours.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see if your competitor managed to damage your business:

success.text: You are safe from your competitor, for the moment.

partial.text: You have been careless. Your competitor may strike against you. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: You hand your competitor a golden opportunity, and they move against your interests. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves for your competitor. For example, your competitor may take control of some of your business dealings, learn one of your secrets, sabotages one of your assets, or harms or buys off someone you care for and trust.

name: Condemned
trigger: At the start of every game session,

description.intro: Your fate has already been sealed. Perhaps you’re dying from a disease, been promised as the sacrificial offering to a forgotten god, or you’ve sold your soul to some entity, waiting to drag you off to hell when your time is up.

success.text: You still have some time remaining.

partial.text: Your fate approaches. The GM chooses one of the following options:
partial.list: |The player marks 1 Time.|You’re tortured by dreams or visions of your fate. Reduce Stability (−2).|You’re haunted by the entity or event that sealed your fate.|Someone in your vicinity is negatively affected by your fate.|Something provides you with false hope of escaping your fate.

fail.text: Your end approaches. The GM holds two options from the list above or marks 2 Time.

suffix.text: When you finally run out of Time, you meet your ultimate fate.

name: Cursed
trigger: In the first session and whenever you’re confronted by the supernatural,

description.intro: You are cursed.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see how strongly the curse influences you:

success.text: You temporarily avoid the curse’s influence.

partial.text: The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make a Move for the curse. For example, you or someone you care about have an accident, something of yours is taken from you, you experience terrifying visions, or you’re forced to take certain actions with risk of dire consequences, if you refuse.

name: Depression
trigger: Whenever facing personal setbacks,

description.intro: You are constantly struggling with depression, which is only worsened by dejection and discouragement.

success.text: You remain in control.

partial.text: You experience temporary anxiety, decreased self-confidence, or lack of will. You take −1 to your next roll.

fail.text: You succumb to the sense of hopelessness or blame and punish yourself; reduce Stability (−2). Your lethargy and self-destructive urges do not go away until you numb your depression with medicine, drugs, or alcohol.

name: Drug Addict
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you have been using, or have the opportunity to use,

description.intro: You are addicted to hard drugs; name at least one when you gain this Disadvantage.

success.text: You are in control of the urge, for now.

partial.text: The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make a Move for your addiction. For example, you cannot resist using the drug, run out of drugs, become indebted to a dangerous person, put yourself in danger while under the influence of drugs, or ruin something important to you – like a relationship – while under the influence.

name: Experiment Gone Wrong
trigger: In the first session and whenever things seem in control,

description.intro: You have carried out a scientific experiment, which went horribly awry. The experiment gave rise to something unnatural, which escaped and disappeared without a trace. Recently, the ‘results’ of your experiment tracked you down, reappearing in your life, and forcing you to either escape or confront it.

success.text: Your experiment leaves you alone.

partial.text: Your experiment is close on your heels. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Your experiment is in your vicinity and acts against you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves on the experiment’s behalf. For example, the experiment gives you a lead on the Truth, sabotages or otherwise disrupts your research, demands something from you under threat of retribution, or kidnaps someone you care for – possibly returning them dead or transformed.

name: Fanatic
trigger: Whenever someone questions your ideology,

description.intro: You are a fervent adherent of an ideology, which you must define when you take this Disadvantage. You interpret the whole world in accordance with your ideology, which must not be questioned.

success.text: You can keep your emotions in check.

partial.text: You become angry, confused, or frustrated. You take −1 to your next roll.

fail.text: You are forced to choose between taking steps to changing the person or situation to adhere to your ideology, or reduce Stability (−2).

name: Greedy
trigger: When an opportunity to increase your wealth arises,

description.intro: You are driven by an unquenchable desire for money and wealth, and are prepared to sacrifice your health, family, and friends to fill the emptiness inside.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see if you are in control of your desire:

success.text: You keep your greed in check.

partial.text: The black void inside shrieks for more. As long as the opportunity exists and you do not take it, you suffer −1 ongoing to any rolls you make.

fail.text: You must take advantage of every opportunity to further your wealth, or reduce Stability (−2).

name: Guilt
trigger: In the first game session and whenever everything appears okay,

description.intro: You carry heavy guilt for your past sins, having harmed one or several people through your actions or inaction.

success.text: Your guilt isn’t on your mind at the moment.

partial.text: You are reminded of your guilt. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Your guilt catches up to you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves for your guilt. For example, relatives of the people you’ve hurt seek you out, demons and other creatures are attracted by your guilt, the dead haunt you with nightmares or visions, or you fall victim to anxiety and self-doubt.

name: Harassed
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you draw attention to yourself,

description.intro: For some reason, personal or otherwise, people tend to harass you; the authorities in particular.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see if you’re harassed:

success.text: You’ve managed to keep clear of harassment.

partial.text: The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves for the harassers. For example, someone destroys your property or possessions, you are bullied and attacked by people with a prejudice against you, the authorities forcefully take something from you (rights, property, assets), someone you care about is harmed for associating with you, or you are denied your basic rights due to your identity.

name: Haunted
trigger: In the first session and whenever you are distracted or weakened,

description.intro: You are haunted by supernatural forces. With the GM’s assistance, determine the nature of what you believe is haunting you.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see if the entity gains power over you:

success.text: The entity leaves you alone.

partial.text: The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make a Move for the entity. For example, it requests a service from you and threatens retribution if you refuse, the entity possesses your body for the night, or the entity reveals a clue of what it is and what it wants from you.

name: Infirm
trigger: Whenever you are subjected to major physical or psychological stress,

description.intro: You suffer from a dangerous physical disease or condition, such as heart disease, hypertension, morbid obesity, or serious gastric ulcer.

success.text: Your condition is under control.

partial.text: Your condition triggers, causing pain and daze (−1 to all rolls until the scene ends).

fail.text: Your condition is aggravated with life threatening results (Endure Injury with 2 Harm).

name: Involuntary Medium
trigger: Whenever you encounter spiritual entities or haunted places,

description.intro: You are an open vessel for any spirits or demonic entities who desire a medium to speak through or need a corporeal body to use for their purposes.

success.text: You resist the possession.

partial.text: The entity gains influence over you. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: The entity gains control over you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves for the being possessing you. For example, the entity may give you a vision, make use of your body, communicate with or through you, try to harm someone else through you, follow you unseen, demand something from you, or drag you into another dimension.

name: Jealousy
trigger: Whenever you encounter the subject of your jealousy or their life’s trappings (possessions, family, friends, etc),

description.intro: There is someone who has the life you want to have, and you would do anything to possess it.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see if you can keep your cool:

success.text: You maintain control over your jealousy.

partial.text: You’re afflicted by jealousy and take −1 ongoing for as long as you remain in the subject’s vicinity, and you do not suppress your jealous desires.

fail.text: Your jealousy takes hold of you. You must Keep it Together to refrain from harming, destroying, or stealing from the subject of your jealousy.

name: Liar
trigger: At the start of every session,

description.intro: You’re a compulsive liar, who invents stories at every opportunity, especially when it’s beneficial for you.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see what trouble your lies have gotten you into this time:

success.text: You have kept your lies tangle-free.

partial.text: You’ve told one too many lies. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Your web of lies has come completely unraveled. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold whenever a PC encounters someone they know to ask, “What have you lied about to this person?” or to invent a troublesome lie the PC has told in the past.

name: Lost Identity
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you encounter something from your repressed past,

description.intro: Your true identity has been lost to a military or private-run secret agent program. You do not remember anything about your pre-employment life. Recently, memories of your true identity have started coming back to you.

success.text: You repress your true identity, remaining in the present.

partial.text: Your true identity is catching up to you. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Your true identity resurfaces. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves for your true identity. For example, you recognize unknown people or places, organizations or individuals from your past life get in touch with you, your old identity influences your thought patterns or actions, or you suffer traumatic flashbacks.

name: Marked
trigger: Whenever you consciously Harm someone,

description.intro: You are marked by the darkness. The mark can take the shape of a full-body tattoo, a demonic body part such as a vestigial arm, an extra eye or mouth, machine parts integrated with your flesh, or similar manifestations.

success.text: You are still in control.

partial.text: You feed the darkness. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: The darkness gains power over you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves for the darkness living inside of you. For example, the darkness feeds on your life energy to sustain itself, forces you to commit murder in order to replenish its life energy, takes charge of your body and leaves you with only memory fragments of what transpired, forces you to harm someone in your vicinity, or temporarily transforms your body into something inhuman. You may have to Keep it Together to resist the darkness’ influence.

name: Mental Compulsion
trigger: In situations where you could be distracted by your compulsion,

lists.options: |Cleaning|Counting|Triple-checking|Showering|Memorizing|Pyromania|Kleptomania|Cursing|Confessing your sins|Eating|Hypochondria

description.intro: You are fixated on a particular idea or action, to the point of it strongly impacting your life. Choose a compulsion when you take this Disadvantage: $OPTIONS$

success.text: You control your compulsions and can focus on other things.

partial.text: You become distracted and take −1 ongoing to all rolls until you have removed yourself from the situation or succumbed to your compulsion, taking any actions it demands of you.

fail.text: You become completely obsessed with your compulsion. If you focus on anything else, reduce Stability (−2).

name: Nemesis
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you let your guard down,

description.intro: Through some terrible act you have made an enemy, who does everything in their power to take revenge. Decide who your nemesis is and what you have done to earn their vengeance.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see if your nemesis moves against you:

success.text: You are safe from your nemesis for the moment.

partial.text: You have been careless and your nemesis moves against you. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: You have compromised your position and your nemesis strikes against you in full force. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves on behalf of your nemesis. For example, your nemesis may strike when you’re alone, use secrets they’ve uncovered to extort you, intimidate you, hire henchmen to capture you, or attack someone or something you hold dear.

name: Nightmares
trigger: During any scene when you sleep,

description.intro: You suffer from recurring nightmares, probably connected to your Dark Secrets.

success.text: You sleep in peace.

partial.text: The nightmares torment you. The GM may make a Move for your nightmares. For example, you are unable to sleep at all during the night (−1 ongoing until you sleep), something follows you back into reality, the nightmares provide you insight into the Truth, or you are forced to process some trauma (Keep it Together) when you wake up.

fail.text: The nightmares take over completely. You are trapped in the dream until you find a way to wake up, and everything that happens there also directly affects your sleeping body.

name: Oath of Revenge
trigger: Whenever the target of your vengeance (or someone/something associated with them) appears,

description.intro: You have sworn to avenge an unforgivable injustice. Decide who is the subject of your vengeance and what they have done to you. It could be a single individual, people who share a certain trait, or members of an organization.

success.text: You remain in control of your vengeful nature and can act rationally.

partial.text: You can’t focus on anything, other than the target of your vengeance. Take −1 ongoing until the target’s involvement in the scene ends.

fail.text: You become obsessed and can act only to further your revenge. Doing anything else requires you roll Keep it Together. Your obsession cannot be assuaged while the target remains in the same scene with you.

name: Object of Desire
trigger: At the first game session and whenever you meet one or more new people,

description.intro: There is just something special about you. You ignite deep unhealthy desires in others, which they are unable to keep in check.

success.text: The desire is not awakened at this moment.

partial.text: Someone becomes desirous of you. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: A strong desire is awakened in one or several people. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to ignite a person’s desires, influencing their behavior. For example, someone can be afflicted with an uncontrollable passion for you, attempt to force themselves on you, strongly proposition you, become intensely jealous of you, or harm themselves or someone else because of their desire of you.

name: Obsession
trigger: At the first game session and whenever you encounter something associated with your obsession,

description.intro: You have discovered a conspiracy or supernatural phenomenon, and you can’t stop yourself from getting to the bottom of it.

success.text: You overcome your obsession for the moment.

partial.text: Your obsession influences your behavior. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Your obsession takes over completely. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to let your obsession creep into your daily life. You may be forced to choose between either engaging in your obsession or losing Stability. You may forget about important tasks and chores, miss meetings, or neglect your interpersonal relationships to solely focus on your obsession. Your obsession may even influence your dreams, giving you visions and revelations. In turn, the object of your obsession may also take note of you and try to stop your investigations.

name: Owned
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you draw attention to yourself in public,

description.intro: You used to be a dangerous person’s private property, willingly or not. Since your escape, your former owner has been looking for you. Decide who your former owner is.

success.text: For the moment, you are safe.

partial.text: Your former owner picks up your scent. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Your owner finds you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make Moves for your former owner. For example, they appear unexpectedly to convince you to return, send henchmen after you, kidnap or harm someone you care about, directly threaten you, destroy something important to you, try to mutilate you so nobody else would want you, or kill you outright so nobody else can have you.

name: Phobia
trigger: Whenever you’re confronted by the object of your phobia,

description.intro: You harbor an overpowering fear of something. Choose the stimulus that frightens you.
description.static: you must Keep it Together.

name: Rationalist
trigger: Whenever you See Through the Illusion and whenever the Illusion shatters,

lists.options: |Your presence nurtures the Illusion, making it more powerful and impenetrable.|Your bewildered psyche starts creating mirror images of familiar places and people in the Illusion.|You attract extradimensional entities.|You consciously deny what you see, even to your own detriment.

description.intro: You refuse to believe in anything not confirmed as fact by modern science, even when it is right in front of you.
description.static: in addition to the standard effects, the GM may choose one option: $OPTIONS$

name: Repressed Memories
trigger: In situations associated with your repressed memories,

description.intro: You have repressed a particularly unpleasant event from your past, but the memory of it sometimes rises to the surface. It could be a crime or some horrible thing you have done, been subjected to, or witnessed. The GM decides the nature of your repressed memory, usually based on your Dark Secrets.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to determine if the memories resurface:

success.text: You continue to suppress the memories.

partial.text: The memories partly resurface, taking the form of flashbacks and/or hallucinations. You must Keep it Together.

fail.text: You are overwhelmed by your repressed memories, completely losing yourself to them. The GM makes a hard Move and you reduce Stability (−2).

name: Rival
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you make a mistake or let down your guard,

description.intro: You have an ambitious rival, who will do anything to be in your shoes. Choose who the rival is.

success.text: All clear; your rival makes no moves against you.

partial.text: You’ve given your rival an opportunity. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: You’ve handed your rival whatever they needed to completely undermine you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make a Move on behalf of your rival. For example, the rival may get an important person on their side, sabotage one of your projects, extort you with evidence damaging to your reputation, or take desperate measures to get rid of you permanently.

name: Schizophrenia
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you go through difficult experiences,

description.intro: You struggle with recurring psychotic episodes and terrifying hallucinations.

success.text: You maintain control of your insanity.

partial.text: The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Schizophrenia overtakes you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make a Move for your schizophrenia. For example, one of your hallucinations takes on physical form, you view your current surroundings as being hostile to you, you’re afflicted by terrifying hallucinations, you’re subjected to dark visions (true or false), or someone in your vicinity turns out to not actually be real.

name: Sexual Neurosis
trigger: Whenever you have the opportunity to have consensual sex or take advantage of someone vulnerable to your advances,

description.intro: Your sexuality is a destructive, controlling force in your life. You compulsively seek out superficial sexual encounters and are willing to perform degrading acts – or even commit crimes – to satisfy your fantasies.

success.text: You can control your urges.

partial.text: Choose between having sex with the person or reduce your Stability (−1).

fail.text: You cannot resist having sex with the person and the GM chooses one option:
fail.list: |You hurt, or you are hurt by, your sexual partner (physically or psychologically).|The boundaries between dimensions are weakened; an entity from beyond catches the scent of you or your lover.|Your sexual partner becomes obsessed with you and starts stalking you.

name: Stalker
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you expose your current location,

description.intro: You are hunted by a faceless enemy. Anyone you meet could be one of their minions – or even the stalker themselves. No one can be trusted. You must constantly change your address and be vigilant at all times to avoid leaving any tracks they can follow.

success.text: You are safe for now.

partial.text: Your enemies are on to you. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: Your enemies have caught up to you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make a Move for your pursuers. For example, a trusted associate has been paid off by them, one of your loved ones or allies disappears, something you are trying to do is undermined by your enemies, or they try to actively hurt you.

name: Victim of Passion
trigger: In the first game session and whenever you encounter the subject of your passions (or anything resembling it),

description.intro: You have an overwhelming passion for someone or something, seeking to possess it at any cost.

success.text: You keep your passion in check.

partial.text: The passion awakens within you. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: You are completely in the passion’s grip. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to let your passion steer your actions. For example, you yearn uncontrollably for the subject of your passion – you must seek it out or reduce Stability (−2), your desire drags the subject of your passion into your dreams (perhaps trapping them there), your passion becomes tainted with jealousy and anger – making you want to control and damage it (Keep it Together to resist), your longing leaves you feeble vis-à-vis the objective of this passion (−1 to all rolls while sharing the same scene), or your passion can attract creatures of lust wishing to feed off it or make pacts with you.

name: Wanted
trigger: Whenever you attract attention to yourself or forget to keep your head down,

description.intro: You are wanted by the authorities – local, state, or federal – for crimes you have committed.

rollPhrase: roll +0 to see if you’ve been discovered:

success.text: You are safe, for now.

partial.text: You have made a mistake. The GM takes 1 Hold.

fail.text: All eyes are on you. The GM takes 3 Hold.

suffix.text: The GM can spend Hold to make a Move for the authorities. For example, your mugshot appears on the TV news and in newspapers, law enforcement officers attempt to trap and catch you, or the authorities detain and interrogate someone you care about, confiscate your possessions, or turn your friends/family against you.

name: Academic Network
trigger: When it would be useful to know someone at a university,

description.intro: You have academic contacts at universities around the world.

rollPhrase: provide the person’s name, field of study, and how you got to know one another, then roll +Charisma:

success.text: The person is a friend (Relation +1).

partial.text: The person is an acquaintance (Relation +0).

fail.text: You know one another, but there is an old enmity between the two of you (Relation +0).

name: Artistic Talent
trigger: Whenever you perform your chosen art form or show your works to an audience,

lists.options: |They want to see more of your art.|They are affected by the emotion you wanted to convey (e.g., anger, sorrow, fear, joy, lust, etc).|They look up to you (take +1 ongoing with the audience during this scene).|Their attention is fixed entirely on you throughout your performance.

rollPhrase: roll +Charisma to influence your audience at any time during the scene:

success.text: Choose up to two options any time during the scene.
success.list: |They want to see more of your art.|They are affected by the emotion you wanted to convey (e.g., anger, sorrow, fear, joy, lust, etc).|They look up to you (take +1 ongoing with the audience during this scene).|Their attention is fixed entirely on you throughout your performance.

partial.text: Choose one option any time during the scene.

fail.text: Choose one option, but a complication/threat manifests. The GM makes a Move.

description.intro: You’re an academic authority in your field and a well-known name in newspapers, debate shows, and scientific journals.

success.text: During this game session, choose up to three options.
success.list: |Influence someone who has heard of your authority in your academic field, as if you had rolled a (15+).|Gain access to a university’s resources, such as their facilities, researchers, or scientific archives.|Make a statement about something or someone in mass media.|Gain access to people or places under the pretense of engaging in your research or studies.

partial.text: During this game session, choose up to two options.

fail.text: People feel like you’re the leader, but one of them tries to challenge you for it. The GM makes a Move.

partial.text: One of them might be able to help, but it will take some convincing.

fail.text: You know someone who can help, but they have already seen through your game. If you want their assistance it will require threats or blackmail to get them to provide it.

success.list: |Make the animal go against its instincts.|Make the animal follow you.|Make the animal protect you against an attacker.

partial.text: Choose two options. You may save one for later.
partial.list: |Make the animal go against its instincts.|Make the animal follow you.|Make the animal protect you against an attacker.

fail.text: Choose one option, but the animal is affected by your memories and Disadvantages. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Make the animal go against its instincts.|Make the animal follow you.|Make the animal protect you against an attacker.

name: Chameleon
trigger: Whenever you imitate another’s appearance or conceal your own identity to trick someone,

success.text: Your disguise is convincing, as long as you keep the act going.

partial.text: You manage to trick everyone who doesn’t examine you in detail, but choose one complication:
partial.list: |You can’t keep this deception up for very long. You must act fast, if you don’t want to risk getting exposed.|You leave traces and clues behind, which can be connected to you later on.

fail.text: Your disguise is only effective at a distance. If you attract any attention to yourself, you will be exposed.

name: Character Actor
trigger: Whenever you try to blend into a place or crowd by adapting your appearance and behavior to the others present,

lists.options: |Placate someone who is becoming suspicious.|Get access to a place outsiders aren’t allowed to go.|Get someone to tell you about this place’s secrets.|Get someone’s assistance with something here.

success.text: Choose three options. You may save up to two for later.
success.list: |Placate someone who is becoming suspicious.|Get access to a place outsiders aren’t allowed to go.|Get someone to tell you about this place’s secrets.|Get someone’s assistance with something here.

partial.text: Choose two options. You may save one for later.
partial.list: |Placate someone who is becoming suspicious.|Get access to a place outsiders aren’t allowed to go.|Get someone to tell you about this place’s secrets.|Get someone’s assistance with something here.

fail.text: Choose one option, but things don’t go according to plan. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Placate someone who is becoming suspicious.|Get access to a place outsiders aren’t allowed to go.|Get someone to tell you about this place’s secrets.|Get someone’s assistance with something here.

name: Crafty
trigger: Whenever you manipulate an NPC in a longer conversation,

lists.options: |They become suspicious of someone else of your choosing.|They view you as their ally, for as long as you don’t betray them (+1 to all rolls against them).|They willingly do a favor for you.

success.text: Choose up to two options. You may save one until later during this scene.
success.list: |They become suspicious of someone else of your choosing.|They view you as their ally, for as long as you don’t betray them (+1 to all rolls against them).|They willingly do a favor for you.

partial.text: Choose one option.
partial.list: |They become suspicious of someone else of your choosing.|They view you as their ally, for as long as you don’t betray them (+1 to all rolls against them).|They willingly do a favor for you.

fail.text: They’re on to you. The GM makes a Move.

name: Extortionist
trigger: Whenever you Read a Person,

lists.questions: |What are you afraid of?|What is precious to you?

description.static: you may choose from these questions in addition to the usual ones: $QUESTIONS$

name: Interrogator
trigger: Whenever you Read a Person and mention a name, person, or object,

description.static: you may always ask “Are you lying?” This doesn’t count towards the number of questions you’re allowed to normally ask.

name: Intuitive
trigger: Whenever you Read a Person,

description.intro: You can sense people’s motives through subconscious readings of their body language, word choices, and behavior.
description.static: you may always ask one additional question, regardless of the outcome of your roll.

name: Observant
trigger: Whenever you Read a Person,

lists.questions: |What sort of person are you?|Is there anything odd about you?

description.static: you may choose from these questions in addition to the usual ones: $QUESTIONS$

name: Vigilant
trigger: Whenever you Read a Person,

lists.questions: |Are you hiding anything from me?|How do you really feel about me?

description.static: you may choose from these questions in addition to the usual ones: $QUESTIONS$

name: Access the Dark Net
trigger: Whenever you search the Dark Net for forbidden information, rare items, or myths,

success.text: You discover what you’re looking for, and may also choose one option:
success.list: |You discover a portal to another dimension, and a path you can trace back to it later.|You make contact with someone – or something – who can help you, for the right price.|You find something valuable or important, in addition to what you were looking for. The GM will tell you what it is.

partial.text: You find what you’re looking for, but you’re also exposed to repulsive and frightening stimuli. You must Keep it Together to see how it affects you.

fail.text: You find what you’re after, but also contact something very dangerous. It might attempt to latch onto you or follow you back into reality. The GM makes a Move.

name: Body Awareness
trigger: Whenever you perform acrobatic or agile feats,

lists.options: |Escape bindings or restraints.|Get past an obstacle (creature or object).|Get into or make it through a space you normally wouldn’t be able to.

description.intro: Your body and mind are as one.

success.text: Choose one option.
success.list: |Escape bindings or restraints.|Get past an obstacle (creature or object).|Get into or make it through a space you normally wouldn’t be able to.

partial.text: Choose one option, but you expose yourself to danger or incur a cost.
partial.list: |Escape bindings or restraints.|Get past an obstacle (creature or object).|Get into or make it through a space you normally wouldn’t be able to.

fail.text: Choose one option, but something goes very wrong. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Escape bindings or restraints.|Get past an obstacle (creature or object).|Get into or make it through a space you normally wouldn’t be able to.

name: Daredevil
trigger: Whenever you’re entering a dangerous situation,

lists.edges: |Keep your eyes open: Discover a threat before it discovers you.|Get out of the way: Avoid an attack.|Get the jump on them: Harm your opponent before they can react.

success.text: Choose three Edges. You may spend them anytime during the scene.
success.list: |Keep your eyes open: Discover a threat before it discovers you.|Get out of the way: Avoid an attack.|Get the jump on them: Harm your opponent before they can react.

partial.text: Choose two Edges. You may spend them anytime during the scene.
partial.list: |Keep your eyes open: Discover a threat before it discovers you.|Get out of the way: Avoid an attack.|Get the jump on them: Harm your opponent before they can react.

fail.text: Choose one Edge, but you are in over your head. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Keep your eyes open: Discover a threat before it discovers you.|Get out of the way: Avoid an attack.|Get the jump on them: Harm your opponent before they can react.

name: Exit Strategy
trigger: Whenever you have killed someone covertly and leave the scene of the murder,

lists.options: |You leave the scene of the murder unnoticed and reach a safe spot of your choosing in the vicinity. Describe how.|You have left no clues that can be traced back to you.|The body is well hidden and will not be found for quite some time. 108

success.text: You get all three options below.
success.list: |You leave the scene of the murder unnoticed and reach a safe spot of your choosing in the vicinity. Describe how.|You have left no clues that can be traced back to you.|The body is well hidden and will not be found for quite some time. 108

partial.text: Choose two of the options below.
partial.list: |You leave the scene of the murder unnoticed and reach a safe spot of your choosing in the vicinity. Describe how.|You have left no clues that can be traced back to you.|The body is well hidden and will not be found for quite some time. 108

fail.text: Choose one option, but you risk discovery or face unexpected obstacles. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |You leave the scene of the murder unnoticed and reach a safe spot of your choosing in the vicinity. Describe how.|You have left no clues that can be traced back to you.|The body is well hidden and will not be found for quite some time. 108

name: Eye for Detail
trigger: Whenever you have had time to study somebody for a while,

lists.questions: |Where are you from?|Are you capable of violence?|How could I seduce or tempt you?|Why are you here?|What are you working on?

success.text: Ask three questions from the list below.
success.list: |Where are you from?|Are you capable of violence?|How could I seduce or tempt you?|Why are you here?|What are you working on?

partial.text: Ask two questions from the list below.
partial.list: |Where are you from?|Are you capable of violence?|How could I seduce or tempt you?|Why are you here?|What are you working on?

fail.text: Ask one question from the list below, but you expose your inquisitiveness to the person you’re observing. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Where are you from?|Are you capable of violence?|How could I seduce or tempt you?|Why are you here?|What are you working on?

name: Hunter
trigger: Whenever you are hunting someone or something,

lists.options: |Set up an ambush for your enemy (deal your weapon’s Harm).|Camouflage (take +2 to Act Under Pressure while you are hiding).|Move in shadows (take +2 to Avoid Harm dealt with a ranged weapon).

success.text: Get three options. You may spend them anytime during this scene.
success.list: |Set up an ambush for your enemy (deal your weapon’s Harm).|Camouflage (take +2 to Act Under Pressure while you are hiding).|Move in shadows (take +2 to Avoid Harm dealt with a ranged weapon).

partial.text: Get two options. You may spend them anytime during this scene.
partial.list: |Set up an ambush for your enemy (deal your weapon’s Harm).|Camouflage (take +2 to Act Under Pressure while you are hiding).|Move in shadows (take +2 to Avoid Harm dealt with a ranged weapon).

fail.text: Get one option, but you become the prey. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Set up an ambush for your enemy (deal your weapon’s Harm).|Camouflage (take +2 to Act Under Pressure while you are hiding).|Move in shadows (take +2 to Avoid Harm dealt with a ranged weapon).

name: Instinct
trigger: Whenever you Observe a Situation and act on the GM’s answers,

description.static: take +2 instead of +1.

name: Keen-Eyed
trigger: Whenever you Observe a Situation,

lists.questions: |What weaknesses do they have I can use to my advantage?|What strengths do they have I should watch out for?

description.static: you may choose from these questions, in addition to the ones normally acquired: $QUESTIONS$

name: Read a Crowd
trigger: Whenever you move through a small crowd to gather information,

lists.questions: |Who here has information I want?|Where can I find what I am looking for?|Who is watching me?|Is there anything else of interest?

rollPhrase: roll +Perception. Examples of a ‘small crowd’ include a party, bar/restaurant, or an office. You decide what specific information you are looking for, as long as it makes sense for the crowd to possess such information:

success.text: Ask three questions.
success.list: |Who here has information I want?|Where can I find what I am looking for?|Who is watching me?|Is there anything else of interest?

partial.text: Ask two questions, but you also draw unwanted attention to yourself.
partial.list: |Who here has information I want?|Where can I find what I am looking for?|Who is watching me?|Is there anything else of interest?

fail.text: Ask one question, but you’ve blown your cover. Those who have what you’re looking for will be expecting you. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Who here has information I want?|Where can I find what I am looking for?|Who is watching me?|Is there anything else of interest?

name: Shadow
trigger: When shadowing someone,

success.text: You avoid discovery, follow your target all the way to their final destination, and learn something about them you can use to your advantage later.

partial.text: You avoid discovery and follow your target to their final destination.

fail.text: You are spotted or encounter some sort of problem along the way. The GM makes a Move. In contrast, whenever you want to lose someone shadowing you, roll +Perception: (15+) You shake your pursuers and can choose to try to shadow them instead. (10–14) You shake your pursuers. (–9) Your pursuers are still on your tail, and they can set up an ambush, disappear without a trace (only to show up when you least expect it), or refuse to go away. The GM makes a Move.

name: Survivalist
trigger: Whenever you utilize your survivalist skills,

lists.options: |Find water and something edible.|Make it past an environmental obstacle.|Find a safe spot to hide and rest.

success.text: Choose up to three options, useable while you remain in this situation.
success.list: |Find water and something edible.|Make it past an environmental obstacle.|Find a safe spot to hide and rest.

partial.text: Choose up to two options, useable while you remain in this situation.
partial.list: |Find water and something edible.|Make it past an environmental obstacle.|Find a safe spot to hide and rest.

fail.text: Choose one option useable while you remain in this situation, but you’ve also overlooked something important. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Find water and something edible.|Make it past an environmental obstacle.|Find a safe spot to hide and rest.

name: Wanderer
trigger: Whenever you are heading out to a community or another part of the city,

lists.options: |Ask the GM one question about this place.|You have a contact at this place who could help you, with a bit of convincing.|You have a hideout here, where you can put your head down and get some rest.|You know something about this place. Tell the others what.

success.text: You have been here before. Choose two options any time during your visit.
success.list: |Ask the GM one question about this place.|You have a contact at this place who could help you, with a bit of convincing.|You have a hideout here, where you can put your head down and get some rest.|You know something about this place. Tell the others what.

partial.text: You have heard of this place. Choose one option any time during your visit.
partial.list: |Ask the GM one question about this place.|You have a contact at this place who could help you, with a bit of convincing.|You have a hideout here, where you can put your head down and get some rest.|You know something about this place. Tell the others what.

fail.text: You have been here before, but something bad happened. Choose one option any time during your visit. The GM explains what kind of problem awaits you here and makes a Move.
fail.list: |Ask the GM one question about this place.|You have a contact at this place who could help you, with a bit of convincing.|You have a hideout here, where you can put your head down and get some rest.|You know something about this place. Tell the others what.

name: Analyst
trigger: Whenever you Investigate something,

lists.questions: |Which organizations, groups, or people of interest may be connected to this?|Is there a connection between this and another event?|What could a plausible motive be?

description.static: you may also choose from these additional questions: $QUESTIONS$

name: Battlefield Medicine
trigger: Whenever you stabilize an injured person’s wounds, even if you don’t have access to medical equipment,

lists.options: |Improvisation: You stabilize one Wound without access to medical equipment.|Effective: You stabilize two Wounds instead of one.|Careful: The wound stabilizes and will heal much faster than normal.

success.text: Choose two options.
success.list: |Improvisation: You stabilize one Wound without access to medical equipment.|Effective: You stabilize two Wounds instead of one.|Careful: The wound stabilizes and will heal much faster than normal.

partial.text: You may choose one option. However, you must also choose one complication:
partial.list: |You leave cosmetic scars or defects (the patient loses Stability (−2).|There are lingering side effects (−1 to all rolls the wound could feasibly affect until it’s fully healed).|The patient remains knocked out until the GM determines that they awaken.

fail.text: You stabilize the wound, even without access to medical equipment, but there are also unexpected and potentially dangerous consequences, such as infections, healing deformities, or other serious side effects. The GM makes a Move.

name: Collector
trigger: Whenever you search for an unusual or rare item,

success.text: You know exactly where the item is, how to acquire it, and how to minimize hazards, obstacles, and/or costs.

partial.text: You know roughly where it is and what hazards, obstacles, and/or costs are associated with acquiring it.

fail.text: You know roughly where to start searching for it, but not the hazards or costs involved in pursuing it.

name: Crime Scene Investigator
trigger: Whenever you investigate a crime scene,

lists.questions: |What was the chain of events?|What can I assume about the perpetrator?|Which mistakes did the perpetrator make?|When was the crime committed?|When was someone here last?|Does the crime remind me of something I am familiar with already and, if so, what?|Who might know more about the crime?

success.text: Ask two questions.
success.list: |What was the chain of events?|What can I assume about the perpetrator?|Which mistakes did the perpetrator make?|When was the crime committed?|When was someone here last?|Does the crime remind me of something I am familiar with already and, if so, what?|Who might know more about the crime?

partial.text: Ask one question.
partial.list: |What was the chain of events?|What can I assume about the perpetrator?|Which mistakes did the perpetrator make?|When was the crime committed?|When was someone here last?|Does the crime remind me of something I am familiar with already and, if so, what?|Who might know more about the crime?

fail.text: Ask one question, but your investigation leads you into danger or introduces additional problems later on.
fail.list: |What was the chain of events?|What can I assume about the perpetrator?|Which mistakes did the perpetrator make?|When was the crime committed?|When was someone here last?|Does the crime remind me of something I am familiar with already and, if so, what?|Who might know more about the crime?

name: Data Retrieval

lists.questions: |What is its origin?|What is it meant for?|How does it work?|What do I have to watch out for?|How can I stop or destroy this? 110

rollPhrase: roll +Reason. In response to the inquiries you make, the GM will tell you what you uncover, in as much detail as can be expected from the source you have utilized:

success.text: Ask three questions.
success.list: |What is its origin?|What is it meant for?|How does it work?|What do I have to watch out for?|How can I stop or destroy this? 110

partial.text: Ask two questions.
partial.list: |What is its origin?|What is it meant for?|How does it work?|What do I have to watch out for?|How can I stop or destroy this? 110

fail.text: Ask one question, but you also discover something unexpected. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |What is its origin?|What is it meant for?|How does it work?|What do I have to watch out for?|How can I stop or destroy this? 110

name: Expert
trigger: Whenever you Investigate something associated with one of your chosen fields,

lists.options: |Archeology|Economics|History|Comparative Literature|Psychology|Sociology|Theology|(Other)

description.intro: You are an expert in certain fields of knowledge. Choose two areas of expertise when you gain this Advantage: $OPTIONS$
description.static: you always get to ask one additional question, regardless of the outcome, and may ask any questions you want.

name: Explosives Expert
trigger: Whenever you’re building an improvised bomb under time pressure,

description.intro: You can build and disarm bombs. If you have enough time and resources, you can build any kind of bomb you like without a roll.

success.text: You construct a functional bomb.

partial.text: The bomb’s blast potential is lower than usual (decrease Harm dealt by −1).

fail.text: The bomb is unpredictable. Maybe it doesn’t detonate, detonates prematurely, or it is more powerful and volatile than expected. The GM makes a Move. When you are disarming a bomb, roll +Reason: (15+) The bomb is deactivated. (10–14) Complications arise. Maybe you can’t completely turn it off, just delay the timer, weaken the explosive effect, or something else turns up and makes thing worse. (–9) Fuck, that’s not good! The bomb may go off in your hands, the timer starts counting down from 10, 9, 8, 7…, or even bigger problems occur. The GM makes a Move.

name: Hacker
trigger: Whenever you penetrate digital networks in the pursuit of confidential data, crack software, or disable security systems,

success.text: You accomplish your task without a problem.

partial.text: Complications arise. Choose one option:
partial.list: |Someone discovers the intrusion. You must take risks or compromise on how much you’re able to accomplish.|You leave traces of your intrusion.

fail.text: Unbeknownst to you, your intrusion didn’t work out as you wanted. Maybe you didn’t succeed at your task as well as you imagined, or you may have been discovered by personal enemies, law enforcement, or something else lurking in the network. The GM makes a Move.

name: Inventor
trigger: Whenever you are about to create or repair something,

lists.options: |Durable: The construction can be used multiple times and doesn’t break easily.|Effective: The construction confers +1 on rolls where it is used for its intended purpose.|Lethal: The construction causes +1 Harm.|Protective: The construction confers +1 armor.

rollPhrase: explain what you are about to do. The GM will tell you what you need to succeed, and once you have collected these materials, you may roll +Reason:

success.text: The construction is successful and you may pick two options from below.
success.list: |Durable: The construction can be used multiple times and doesn’t break easily.|Effective: The construction confers +1 on rolls where it is used for its intended purpose.|Lethal: The construction causes +1 Harm.|Protective: The construction confers +1 armor.

partial.text: The construction has minor flaws. You may choose one option from below.
partial.list: |Durable: The construction can be used multiple times and doesn’t break easily.|Effective: The construction confers +1 on rolls where it is used for its intended purpose.|Lethal: The construction causes +1 Harm.|Protective: The construction confers +1 armor.

fail.text: You complete the construction or repair, but it has significant flaws, some of which are hidden. The GM makes a Move.

name: Manhunter
trigger: Whenever you’re out to get information about someone,

lists.questions: |What is their background?|What or who do they love most of all?|Who do they surround themselves with, like, and/or trust?|Where are they located right now?|How can I best gain access to them?

success.text: Ask the GM three questions from the list below.
success.list: |What is their background?|What or who do they love most of all?|Who do they surround themselves with, like, and/or trust?|Where are they located right now?|How can I best gain access to them?

partial.text: Ask the GM two questions from the list below.
partial.list: |What is their background?|What or who do they love most of all?|Who do they surround themselves with, like, and/or trust?|Where are they located right now?|How can I best gain access to them?

fail.text: Ask the GM one question from the list below, but someone figures out you’ve been snooping around.
fail.list: |What is their background?|What or who do they love most of all?|Who do they surround themselves with, like, and/or trust?|Where are they located right now?|How can I best gain access to them?

lists.options: |I know something about this (ask the GM what you know and take +1 ongoing while acting on the answers during this scene).|I know where I can find more information about this (ask the GM where).

description.intro: You are a student of the occult.

success.text: Take both options below.

success.text: Choose three options.
success.list: |Find or create a map of the location.|Uncover any security systems and other obstacles.|Pinpoint the location of something you’re after.

partial.text: Choose two options.
partial.list: |Find or create a map of the location.|Uncover any security systems and other obstacles.|Pinpoint the location of something you’re after.

trigger: Whenever you execute a plan using other people as pawns,

success.text: Everyone involved takes +1 ongoing to carry out the plan, and you get one Experience if the plan is successful.

partial.text: You get one Experience if the plan is successful, but you have overlooked or miscalculated something.

fail.text: Your plan is inadequate, revealed, and/or misguided. The GM makes a Move.

lists.questions: |Where in the world was this seen last?|What people have associated themselves with what I’m looking for lately?|What tracks and marks has it left behind?|Who else is trying to find what I’m looking for? 112

success.text: Ask up to three of the questions below.

name: Artifact
trigger: Whenever you activate the object,

lists.options: The GM may wish to modify this list of options, either on their own or by working together with the player to come up with what exactly the PC’s artifact can do.|See the true form of a creature or location.|Receive a vision of what threatens you.|Get yourself out of a bind.|Call on the entity bound to the artifact and bargain with them.

description.intro: You own a seemingly mundane item, which actually possesses mystical powers. Its powers can be activated through certain methods, such as infusing it with blood or whispering forbidden words (you decide what is required).

success.text: Choose one option (the GM determines what happens).

fail.text: The artifact does something unexpected, possibly dangerous. The GM makes a Move.

success.text: You may choose up to three options at any time during the session.
success.list: |See the true form of a creature or location.|Disperse magic targeting you.|Call on the entity.

partial.text: You may choose one option at any time during the session.
partial.list: |See the true form of a creature or location.|Disperse magic targeting you.|Call on the entity.

fail.text: You may choose one option at any time during the session, but the GM makes a Move for the entity at some point during the session.
fail.list: |See the true form of a creature or location.|Disperse magic targeting you.|Call on the entity.

success.text: Choose two options.

name: Cult Leader
trigger: Whenever you and your followers perform a ritual,

lists.options: |a vision of a creature’s true form.|a vision of a portal between dimensions.|a vision of the cult’s enemies.|a vision of an object's purpose.|a vision revealing your deity’s wishes (take +1 to all rolls while fulfilling their wishes).

success.text: Choose to receive up to three visions from the list below.
success.list: |a vision of a creature’s true form.|a vision of a portal between dimensions.|a vision of the cult’s enemies.|a vision of an object's purpose.|a vision revealing your deity’s wishes (take +1 to all rolls while fulfilling their wishes).

partial.text: Choose to receive up to two visions from the list below.
partial.list: |a vision of a creature’s true form.|a vision of a portal between dimensions.|a vision of the cult’s enemies.|a vision of an object's purpose.|a vision revealing your deity’s wishes (take +1 to all rolls while fulfilling their wishes).

fail.text: Choose one vision, but the Illusion tears as a result. You may temporarily be transported into another dimension, attract a demonic being’s attention, or receive a horrifying omen. The GM makes a Move.

name: Dabbler in the Occult
trigger: Whenever you attempt to perform a magical ritual from a set of instructions,

description.intro: You know a little of magical rituals, but have never gone beyond performing written instructions.

success.text: You perform every step correctly; the ritual works as intended.

partial.text: You make a minor error. The GM chooses one complication:
partial.list: |You do not have working protection against the forces or entities the ritual summons.|The effects of the ritual are slightly different than what you had imagined.|The ritual summons unexpected entities or forces.

fail.text: You misunderstand the scripture and perform the ritual with no control whatsoever over the resulting outcome. The GM makes a Move.

name: Divine
trigger: Whenever you encounter a monstrous creature,

lists.options: |Soothe an aggressive creature.|Command the creature and force it to obey your order.

description.intro: There is something about you that reminds your former servants of what you truly are.

success.text: The creature mistakes you for a god. Choose up to three options, useable any time during this scene.
success.list: |Soothe an aggressive creature.|Command the creature and force it to obey your order.

partial.text: You are fascinating to the creature. Choose one option.
partial.list: |Soothe an aggressive creature.|Command the creature and force it to obey your order.

fail.text: You may choose one option, but after using it the creature becomes determined to possess you. It might try to devour you or perhaps capture you. The GM makes a Move.
fail.list: |Soothe an aggressive creature.|Command the creature and force it to obey your order.

name: Dreamer
trigger: Whenever you want to meet someone or find out the truth about something in the Dream,

description.intro: You are a talented, self-taught dream wanderer.

success.text: You meet the intended person or arrive at the specific place in the Dream.

partial.text: You meet the intended person, or arrive at the specific place. However, some element has changed, or something followed you or the person in question.

fail.text: You are lost in the Dream and cannot wake up until you find your way back.

name: Enhanced Awareness
trigger: When you focus your senses at a location where the Illusion is weak,
rollPhrase: roll +Soul. On a success, you have visions about the place and may be able to speak to entities tied to it:

success.text: You can discern clear details regarding the location.

partial.text: You get some basic impressions regarding the location.

fail.text: The Illusion tears. The veil is lifted temporarily, revealing an alternate dimension – the GM determines which one. The PC could be sucked into it or something may cross over into our reality. The GM makes a Move.

name: Exorcist
trigger: Whenever you perform an exorcism to banish a spirit or extradimensional creature,

lists.options: |Nobody is harmed during the ritual.|The entity will not reappear later.|The entity will not become hostile toward you.

rollPhrase: explain what the ritual looks like and roll +Soul:

success.text: The creature is banished. Choose two options.
success.list: |Nobody is harmed during the ritual.|The entity will not reappear later.|The entity will not become hostile toward you.

partial.text: The creature is banished. Choose one option.
partial.list: |Nobody is harmed during the ritual.|The entity will not reappear later.|The entity will not become hostile toward you.

fail.text: The creature resists banishment and something goes terribly wrong, such as the creature possessing you. The GM makes a Move.

trigger: Whenever you dive deep into your art and allow yourself to be inspired by the Truth,

lists.options: |Enticement: Entice an entity to come to you.|Visions: See Through the Illusion into a specific place of your choice.|Inspiration: Ask the GM if there is anything strange or supernatural about the situation you’re in. The answer will be revealed through your art. 114

success.text: Choose two options.
success.list: |Enticement: Entice an entity to come to you.|Visions: See Through the Illusion into a specific place of your choice.|Inspiration: Ask the GM if there is anything strange or supernatural about the situation you’re in. The answer will be revealed through your art. 114

name: Implanted Messages
trigger: Whenever you experiment on a human,
rollPhrase: you may implant an order into them. Roll +Soul:

success.text: You hold 2 Power over them. For as long as you retain Power over them, they take 1 Serious Wound should they refuse or attempt to go against your order, but this loosens your grip over them by 1 Power. If they fulfill your order, all your remaining Power over them is removed.

partial.text: You hold 1 Power over them. For as long as you retain Power over them, they take 1 Serious Wound should they refuse or attempt to go against your order, but this loosens your grip over them by 1 Power. If they fulfill your order, all your remaining Power over them is removed.

fail.text: Something goes wrong, such as they get hurt in the process or the order’s outcome is different than what you imagined. The GM makes a Move.

name: Inner Power
trigger: Whenever you release your inner power,

description.intro: You harbor a mysterious power, which you do not fully understand. The power can protect you, but you have no control over it.

success.text: The power attacks all opponents in your vicinity, causing 2 Harm.

partial.text: The power attacks your closest opponent, causing 2 Harm.

fail.text: The power attacks all living beings, including yourself, in the vicinity, causing 2 Harm.

name: Lay on Hands
trigger: Whenever you lay your hands on a seriously or critically wounded person and pray,

description.intro: You are able to heal others’ wounds without using medicine or first aid, but you must channel the injuries onto yourself or another living victim. To transfer the Wound, you must be able to see the victim, but not touch them and they are not required to consent. The wound transferred is of the same type, severity, and condition as the original.

success.text: You fully heal the injured person, channeling the Wound onto yourself or a selected target.

partial.text: You stabilize the injured, channeling the Wound onto yourself or a selected target.

fail.text: You may choose to stabilize the injured, but if you do, the powers break free from your control.

success.list: |Ask the creature for help with a problem.|Ask the creature for something you desire.

partial.text: Choose one option.
partial.list: |Ask the creature for help with a problem.|Ask the creature for something you desire.

fail.text: The desire is beyond the creature’s ability to regulate. It cannot help but attempt to devour or imprison you.

name: Wayfinder
trigger: Whenever you travel between two places in the city and allow your madness to guide you through the alleys,

success.text: You discover a shortcut through the alleys, which takes you to your destination within a few minutes, regardless of how far the distance actually is.

partial.text: You discover a shortcut, but there is also some sort of obstacle you will need to get past.

fail.text: You discover a shortcut, but it leads you into a dangerous situation, such as the lair of some creature or an ambush set by some gang. The GM makes a Move. 116

name: Deadly Stare
trigger: Whenever you find yourself in a charged situation,

success.text: You make eye contact with an NPC, causing them to freeze up and be unable to take any actions until you break eye contact. You also get +2 ongoing against your target.

partial.text: You make eye contact with an NPC, causing them to freeze up and be unable to take any actions until you break eye contact.

fail.text: Your opponents see you as their primary threat.

trigger: Whenever you fight with no regard for your personal safety,

lists.edges: |Eager: Engage an additional hostile in Combat.|Vicious: deal +2 Harm with one attack.|Frantic: get within reach to attack a hostile.|Reckless: frighten your opponents by laughing into the face of death (+1 ongoing during the fight).

success.text: Get 3 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.
success.list: |Eager: Engage an additional hostile in Combat.|Vicious: deal +2 Harm with one attack.|Frantic: get within reach to attack a hostile.|Reckless: frighten your opponents by laughing into the face of death (+1 ongoing during the fight).

partial.text: Get 2 Edges. You may spend them any time during the scene.
partial.list: |Eager: Engage an additional hostile in Combat.|Vicious: deal +2 Harm with one attack.|Frantic: get within reach to attack a hostile.|Reckless: frighten your opponents by laughing into the face of death (+1 ongoing during the fight).

fail.text: Get 1 Edge, but afterwards you discover you have been injured without noticing it (Endure Injury; the GM determines the amount of Harm based on who attacked you and how).
fail.list: |Eager: Engage an additional hostile in Combat.|Vicious: deal +2 Harm with one attack.|Frantic: get within reach to attack a hostile.|Reckless: frighten your opponents by laughing into the face of death (+1 ongoing during the fight).

trigger: Whenever you credibly threaten someone directly or suggestively,

success.text: They must decide to either do what you want or defy you with the knowledge that you can execute your threat.

You take +2 on your roll to Engage in Combat if you counterattack.

fail.text: Turns out you didn’t have the advantage you thought you did. The GM makes a Move.

name: Intimidating

description.intro: There is something about you that instinctively makes others fear you.

success.text: They succumb to fear and give in to your demands.

partial.text: They run away from you or give in to you, GM’s choice.

fail.text: They see you as their primary threat and act accordingly. The GM makes a Move for them.
